entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 11.18.19 06:02PM, Priority: Urgent
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content:
.

With the discontinuation of NHGRI funding for GenomeSpace we have shut down the servers. 

GenomeSpace Recipes can be found at  http://recipes.genomespace.org/ however data transfer through GenomeSpace will not be available.

More details can be found at  http://www.genomespace.org/news/the-genomespace-project-is-ending

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 11.07.19 02:39PM, Priority: Urgent
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content:
.

Download your files and data soon!

The GenomeSpace project ends on November 15, 2019 due to expiration of its NHGRI funding. Please save any data from your GenomeSpace account by transferring it to your own storage before that date. More details at http://www.genomespace.org/news/the-genomespace-project-is-ending

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 09.22.19 04:29PM, Priority: Urgent
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content: The GenomeSpace project ends on November 15, 2019 due to expiration of its NHGRI funding. Please save any data from your GenomeSpace account by transferring it to your own storage before that date. More details at http://www.genomespace.org/news/the-genomespace-project-is-ending

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 04.04.19 03:04PM, Priority: General
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content:
Update:  Galaxy developers are hoping to restore GenomeSpace connectivity later this month (April, 2019).
 
We just learned that Galaxy has deployed a new version which is not compatible with GenomeSpace. Because funding for the GenomeSpace project ends soon we will not be able to make the changes required to continue communication between Galaxy and GenomeSpace. We sincerely regret any inconvenience this may cause you.  However, we note that to the best of our knowledge all of the other GenomeSpace member tools remain accessible. 
 
Currently all systems are operating normally.

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 12.06.18 12:38PM, Priority: General
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content:
The GenePattern server is moving to http://cloud.genepattern.org  This new home allows it to provide more flexible compute power & support the growing analysis needs of the genomics research community, while remaining a free resource to the community. This new GenePattern instance is available to be added to your GenomeSpace toolbars now, and the old one will be removed Wed November 28th at noon EST.  After that time the retiring GenePattern instance will be removed from the GenomeSpace toolbar, though you will still be able to export files to GenomeSpace from it.
 
Read more: on the GenePattern blog
 
Currently, all systems are operating normally.

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 10.30.18 02:39PM, Priority: General

The GenePattern server is moving to http://cloud.genepattern.org  This new home allows it to provide more flexible compute power & support the growing analysis needs of the genomics research community, while remaining a free resource to the community. This new GenePattern instance is available to be added to your GenomeSpace toolbars now, and the old one will be removed at the end of December.
 
Read more: https://buff.ly/2O5dXd1
 
Currently all systems are operating normally.

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 09.18.15 03:51PM, Priority: General
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content: The genomespace.org SSL certificate has expired.  We are working to correct this as quickly as possible.  In the meantime you may see errors accessing the GenomeSpace User interface and retrieving files from GenomeSpace.  No files or data have been lost and we will strive to make this outage as short as possible.

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 05.14.13 03:45PM, Priority: General
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content:
The recently released versions of firefox (20.0, 21.0)  cause the GenomeSpace User Interface page to reload when launching IGV on a file from that page.  We are working to resolve this problem.  As a workaround, use another browser (Chrome, Safari) or launch IGV then load files from GenomeSpace within IGV's GenomeSpace menu

All other systems are operating normally.

entry.content: Following the recent maintenance there is a problem with file sharing in GenomeSpace.  1. You cannot currently unshare a file you have shared to others.  Engineers are working on a fix.

All systems are operating normally.

entry.content:

All systems are operating normally.

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 10.25.12 10:15AM, Priority: General
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content:
We will be transitioning the Galaxy instance used by GenomeSpace to the main Galaxy server at main.g2.bx.psu.edu at noon on Wednesday October 24th. 

Details are available at http://www.genomespace.org/news/genomespace-moving-to-galaxy-s-production-servers.

All systems are operating normally.

The GenomeSpace user interface has been updated to have more consistent menus.  A spurious authentication dialog seen when logging out and back in has been put to rest and several other minor bugs have been fixed.

entry.title: GenomeSpace System Status as of 05.25.12 09:28AM, Priority: General
entry.author: The GenomeSpace Team
entry.content:
All systems are currently operating normally.

The GenomeSpace user interface was updated. 

  • you can now view a preview of text files on the GenomeSpace servers
  • a gct/res (GenePattern) to .geneset.tab (Genomica) format converter was added
  • Launching desktop apps (IGV, Cytoscape, Genomica) no longer generates spurious blank windows on Safari
